page.title: 06RELIGION PURBECK HOUSE
page.content: There are 9 Christian religions in Swanage today. Purbeck House belongs to the Sisters of Mercy R.C. nuns. George Burt built Purbeck House in 1875. It is typical of 2nd class taste with it's Scottish baronial style dominating the High St. The Sisters of Mercy bought the house in 1935 and have just celebrated their 50th anniversary. They contribute to the quality of life in Swanage by helping the sick, poor and handicapped. They visit the sick and elderly and help in the Local Day Centre. Here the elderly can meet one another and be given a hot meal. Apart from doing voluntary work the Sisters teach in St. Mary's First School which is in the grounds of Purbeck House. One Sister nurses in Swanage Cottage Hospital and another Sister teaches in Wimborne.
